_header: Thus musing in my mind greatly marveling
_description: On a variable mistress — in eight-line stanzas

CamFitzMus.Note:
Cambridge UK,  Fitzwilliam Museum Mus 1005 comprises the bottom half of the Drexel page
                        (5903-3).

NYPLDrexFr4183.Transcription:
…love shuld comOn euery syde þe way she pryde [ ][ ]
                    thyng cowde flye nor gooBut styll went she yt had byn yeWhen hyt was
                    no thyng sooWhen hyt was no thyng Soo[ ] love to comA dew my love
                    I wyll remove[ ]yst wold I had ben doneWhen I so sone grant yow your
                    boneSeyyng ye wyll not come seyng ye wyll not come
NYPLDrexFr4183.Note:
Variant; parts of two verses of a song; portions of pages cut away to
                    fit as endleaves to seventeenth-century song book.
NYPLDrexFr4183.Editions:
Stevens,  John,
                        ed.  
             Early Tudor Songs and Carols.
Musica Britannica
         36. London: Stainer and Bell, 1975.

ChicagoUL253.First Lines:
Thus musyng in my mind gretly meuelynghow euer soch adauersete in
                    one person may be…
ChicagoUL253.Last Lines:
…Wherefore I thynke to haue a specyall remedyTo lett yt ouer
                    pas & thynke ther on no more
ChicagoUL253.Editions:
Edwards,  A. S. G. 
             “An Unrecorded Copy of Index of Middle English Verse 3724.5.” 
             Notes and Queries
         n.s. 43 [241] (1996): 403: 403.
